main.name: Brett Bass
main.occupation: UC San Diego Computer Scientist and Engineering Student
main.description: I found my interest in computer science through restarting my education in community college. It was the courses I took in mathematics that guided me towards my love for problem solving. This was beginning of a snowball effect where I developed a strong passion towards engineering. A computer to me is my most powerful tool inwhich I can create something that can make the world a little bit better for everyone.
main.bio: I'm not someone who found a way to solve a problem. I'm someone who just wants to make something that can make the world a little bit better for everyone. I wasn't the smartest person in any of my classes, However I work hard. I don't have that throught process anymore of "I should do this", "I need to do that", I think in the sense of "I have to do this", "I have to get this done". This is the thought process and work ethic that defines me. I don't care how hard something is, I'm going to get it done.
main.contactmessage: Contact service not currently working, please reach out to me via call or text.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
education.description: Describe your experience at school, what you learned, what useful skills you have acquired etc.

Pierce College to me was a place to start over and discover what I wanted to do in life. Once I discovered what I was passonate about, school became easy and exiting. The grind became meaningful and I redevelopped my work ethic and my love for the process.

testimonials.text: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.
As I get older, I realize being wrong isn't a bad thing like they teach you in schol. It is an opportunity to learn something.
